question: [File: aptos-core/config/src/config/consensus_observer_config.rs] [Field: network_request_timeout_ms] [Timeout Too Long] Can excessively large network_request_timeout_ms values (e.g., hours) prevent detection of network failures, allowing observers to hang waiting for dead connections? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/consensus_observer_config.rs] [Field: garbage_collection_interval_ms] [GC Starvation] Can garbage_collection_interval_ms=60000ms be too infrequent for high-block-rate networks, causing memory leaks from accumulated stale peer state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/consensus_observer_config.rs] [Field: garbage_collection_interval_ms] [GC Thrashing] Can very small garbage_collection_interval_ms values cause excessive GC overhead that interferes with consensus message processing? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/consensus_observer_config.rs] [Field: max_num_pending_blocks] [Buffer Overflow] When max_num_pending_blocks=150 is exceeded, are oldest blocks evicted or newest blocks rejected, and can this be exploited to force observers to drop critical blocks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/consensus_observer_config.rs] [Field: max_num_pending_blocks] [Chain Reorganization] If block rate spikes above 150 blocks within processing window, can observers lose track of valid chain head causing consensus divergence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/consensus_observer_config.rs] [Field: max_num_pending_blocks] [Testnet Value] Can MAX_NUM_PENDING_BLOCKS_FOR_TEST_NETWORKS=300 be insufficient for stress tests running at maximum throughput (e.g., 10k TPS), causing buffer exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/consensus_observer_config.rs] [Field: progress_check_interval_ms] [Detection Delay] Can progress_check_interval_ms=5000ms create 5-second windows where stuck observers are not detected, allowing stale state to be served to clients? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/consensus_observer_config.rs] [Field: progress_check_interval_ms] [Check Overhead] Can very frequent progress checks consume excessive CPU verifying sync state, reducing resources available for actual consensus processing? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/consensus_observer_config.rs] [Field: max_concurrent_subscriptions] [Subscription Exhaustion] With max_concurrent_subscriptions=2, can malicious peers consume both subscription slots preventing connections to honest validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/consensus_observer_config.rs] [Field: max_concurrent_subscriptions] [Byzantine Peer Exploit] Can Byzantine validators monopolize all subscription slots (=2) on observer nodes, filtering or delaying consensus messages to create partitions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/consensus_observer_config.rs] [Field: max_concurrent_subscriptions] [Single Point Failure] If max_concurrent_subscriptions=2 and both peers become Byzantine, can observer nodes be completely isolated from honest consensus? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/consensus_observer_config.rs] [Field: max_subscription_sync_timeout_ms] [Sync Timeout Attack] Can malicious peers send partial blocks to keep synced_version incrementing just enough to avoid max_subscription_sync_timeout_ms=15000ms timeout? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/consensus_observer_config.rs] [Field: max_subscription_timeout_ms] [Message Delay Attack] Can adversaries delay consensus messages by 14999ms (just under max_subscription_timeout_ms=15000ms) to slow observer sync without triggering timeouts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/consensus_observer_config.rs] [Field: subscription_peer_change_interval_ms] [Slow Peer Detection] Can subscription_peer_change_interval_ms=180000ms (3 minutes) delay detection of compromised peers, allowing them to serve stale/incorrect blocks for extended periods? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/consensus_observer_config.rs] [Field: subscription_refresh_interval_ms] [Refresh Attack] Can subscription_refresh_interval_ms=600000ms (10 minutes) force observers to maintain stale connections to Byzantine peers for extended durations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/consensus_observer_config.rs] [Field: subscription_refresh_interval_ms] [Connection Thrashing] Can very small subscription_refresh_interval_ms cause excessive reconnection overhead disrupting stable consensus observation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/consensus_observer_config.rs] [Field: observer_fallback_duration_ms] [Fallback Exit Race] When observer_fallback_duration_ms=600000ms (10 min) expires, can observers exit fallback before state sync completes causing incomplete synchronization? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/consensus_observer_config.rs] [Field: observer_fallback_startup_period_ms] [Startup Race Condition] Can observer_fallback_startup_period_ms=60000ms be insufficient for slow-starting nodes, causing premature fallback activation before consensus observer initializes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/consensus_observer_config.rs] [Field: observer_fallback_progress_threshold_ms] [Progress Detection] Can observer_fallback_progress_threshold_ms=10000ms be exploited by adversaries who delay blocks by 9999ms to avoid triggering fallback while degrading performance? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/consensus_observer_config.rs] [Field: observer_fallback_sync_lag_threshold_ms] [Lag Threshold Attack] Can observer_fallback_sync_lag_threshold_ms=15000ms allow observers to operate 15 seconds behind chain head before fallback, serving stale state to clients? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/consensus_observer_config.rs] [Field: observer_fallback_sync_lag_threshold_ms] [Threshold Bypass] Can malicious publishers send blocks at exactly 14999ms intervals to keep observers just under observer_fallback_sync_lag_threshold_ms preventing fallback activation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/consensus_observer_config.rs] [Multiple Fields] [Timeout Inconsistency] Can max_subscription_timeout_ms (15s), max_subscription_sync_timeout_ms (15s), and network_request_timeout_ms (5s) have conflicting values causing cascading timeouts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/consensus_observer_config.rs] [Multiple Fields] [Fallback Timing] Can observer_fallback_progress_threshold_ms (10s) be less than progress_check_interval_ms (5s) creating race conditions in fallback detection logic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/consensus_observer_config.rs] [Multiple Fields] [Resource Limit Interaction] Can max_num_pending_blocks * block_size exceed available memory when combined with max_network_channel_size message buffering? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/consensus_observer_config.rs] [Multiple Fields] [Subscription vs Network Timeout] Can network_request_timeout_ms (5s) being shorter than max_subscription_timeout_ms (15s) cause premature subscription failures before messages complete? (Medium)
